messages.content: You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Zr2N is Rutile structured and crystallizes in the tetragonal P4_2/mnm space group. Zr(1) is bonded in a distorted T-shaped geometry to three equivalent N(1) atoms. All Zr(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.27 Å. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Zr(1) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NZr6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 47°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.4107297929166691 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Zr3N is Uranium Silicide structured and crystallizes in the cubic Pm-3m space group. Zr(1) is bonded in a square co-planar geometry to four equivalent N(1) atoms. All Zr(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.92 Å. N(1) is bonded to twelve equivalent Zr(1) atoms to form a mixture of face and corner-sharing NZr12 cuboctahedra. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 0.501047520312504 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Zr3N crystallizes in the tetragonal I4/mmm space group. There are two inequivalent Zr sites. In the first Zr site, Zr(1) is bonded in a 12-coordinate geometry to four equivalent Zr(1), four equivalent Zr(2), and four equivalent N(1) atoms. All Zr(1)-Zr(1) bond lengths are 2.75 Å. All Zr(1)-Zr(2) bond lengths are 3.11 Å. All Zr(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 3.11 Å. In the second Zr site, Zr(2) is bonded in a square co-planar geometry to eight equivalent Zr(1) and four equivalent N(1) atoms. All Zr(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.75 Å. N(1) is bonded to four equivalent Zr(2) and eight equivalent Zr(1) atoms to form a mixture of distorted edge, face, and corner-sharing NZr12 cuboctahedra. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : 0.49219902281250305 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Zr3N2 is Corundum structured and crystallizes in the trigonal R-3c space group. Zr(1) is bonded in a distorted rectangular see-saw-like geometry to four equivalent N(1) atoms. There are two shorter (2.27 Å) and two longer (2.30 Å) Zr(1)-N(1) bond lengths. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Zr(1) atoms to form a mixture of edge, face, and corner-sharing NZr6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 48-52°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.615370775500002 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Zr3N4 crystallizes in the cubic I-43d space group. Zr(1) is bonded in a 8-coordinate geometry to eight equivalent N(1) atoms. There are four shorter (2.22 Å) and four longer (2.48 Å) Zr(1)-N(1) bond lengths. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Zr(1) atoms to form a mixture of distorted edge, face, and corner-sharing NZr6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 21-48°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.6862 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.7916726607142852 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Zr3N4 crystallizes in the orthorhombic Pnma space group. There are three inequivalent Zr sites. In the first Zr site, Zr(1) is bonded in a 6-coordinate geometry to one N(1), one N(2), two equivalent N(3), and two equivalent N(4) atoms. The Zr(1)-N(1) bond length is 2.08 Å. The Zr(1)-N(2) bond length is 2.37 Å. Both Zr(1)-N(3) bond lengths are 2.32 Å. Both Zr(1)-N(4) bond lengths are 2.22 Å. In the second Zr site, Zr(2) is bonded in a 7-coordinate geometry to one N(2), one N(3), two equivalent N(4), and three equivalent N(1) atoms. The Zr(2)-N(2) bond length is 2.19 Å. The Zr(2)-N(3) bond length is 2.74 Å. Both Zr(2)-N(4) bond lengths are 2.46 Å. There are two shorter (2.10 Å) and one longer (2.18 Å) Zr(2)-N(1) bond length. In the third Zr site, Zr(3) is bonded to one N(4), two equivalent N(2), and three equivalent N(3) atoms to form edge-sharing ZrN6 octahedra. The Zr(3)-N(4) bond length is 2.14 Å. Both Zr(3)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.10 Å. All Zr(3)-N(3) bond lengths are 2.37 Å. There are four inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded to one Zr(1) and three equivalent Zr(2) atoms to form NZr4 tetrahedra that share  a cornercorner with one N(3)Zr6 octahedra, corners with two equivalent N(1)Zr4 tetrahedra, corners with four equivalent N(2)Zr4 trigonal pyramids, edges with two equivalent N(3)Zr6 octahedra, and edges with two equivalent N(1)Zr4 tetrahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 45°. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to one Zr(1), one Zr(2), and two equivalent Zr(3) atoms to form distorted NZr4 trigonal pyramids that share corners with three equivalent N(3)Zr6 octahedra, corners with four equivalent N(1)Zr4 tetrahedra, corners with two equivalent N(2)Zr4 trigonal pyramids, and edges with three equivalent N(3)Zr6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 10-37°. In the third N site, N(3) is bonded to one Zr(2), two equivalent Zr(1), and three equivalent Zr(3) atoms to form NZr6 octahedra that share  a cornercorner with one N(1)Zr4 tetrahedra, corners with three equivalent N(2)Zr4 trigonal pyramids, edges with four equivalent N(3)Zr6 octahedra, edges with two equivalent N(1)Zr4 tetrahedra, and edges with three equivalent N(2)Zr4 trigonal pyramids. In the fourth N site, N(4) is bonded in a 5-coordinate geometry to one Zr(3), two equivalent Zr(1), and two equivalent Zr(2) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.970499999999999 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.852383193928572 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Zr3N4 crystallizes in the trigonal R-3m space group. There are two inequivalent Zr sites. In the first Zr site, Zr(1) is bonded in a 7-coordinate geometry to three equivalent N(1) and four equivalent N(2) atoms. All Zr(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.60 Å. There are three shorter (2.05 Å) and one longer (2.28 Å) Zr(1)-N(2) bond length. In the second Zr site, Zr(2) is bonded to six equivalent N(1) atoms to form edge-sharing ZrN6 octahedra. All Zr(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.29 Å. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded to three equivalent Zr(1) and three equivalent Zr(2) atoms to form NZr6 octahedra that share corners with three equivalent N(1)Zr6 octahedra, corners with six equivalent N(2)Zr4 tetrahedra, edges with nine equivalent N(1)Zr6 octahedra, and edges with three equivalent N(2)Zr4 tetrahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to four equivalent Zr(1) atoms to form NZr4 tetrahedra that share corners with six equivalent N(1)Zr6 octahedra, corners with six equivalent N(2)Zr4 tetrahedra, edges with three equivalent N(1)Zr6 octahedra, and edges with three equivalent N(2)Zr4 tetrahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 26-50°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.984399999999999 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.800390252857143 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Zr3N4 is Hausmannite structured and crystallizes in the cubic Fd-3m space group. There are two inequivalent Zr sites. In the first Zr site, Zr(1) is bonded to six equivalent N(1) atoms to form ZrN6 octahedra that share corners with six equivalent Zr(2)N4 tetrahedra and edges with six equivalent Zr(1)N6 octahedra. All Zr(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.22 Å. In the second Zr site, Zr(2) is bonded to four equivalent N(1) atoms to form corner-sharing ZrN4 tetrahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 57°. All Zr(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.10 Å. N(1) is bonded to one Zr(2) and three equivalent Zr(1) atoms to form a mixture of distorted edge and corner-sharing NZr4 trigonal pyramids. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.5628999999999991 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.809822919285713 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

ZrN is Tetraauricupride structured and crystallizes in the cubic Pm-3m space group. Zr(1) is bonded in a body-centered cubic geometry to eight equivalent N(1) atoms. All Zr(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.47 Å. N(1) is bonded in a body-centered cubic geometry to eight equivalent Zr(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.089742936875001 eV/atom.

ZrN is Tungsten Carbide structured and crystallizes in the hexagonal P-6m2 space group. Zr(1) is bonded to six equivalent N(1) atoms to form a mixture of distorted edge, face, and corner-sharing ZrN6 pentagonal pyramids. All Zr(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.34 Å. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Zr(1) atoms to form a mixture of distorted edge, face, and corner-sharing NZr6 pentagonal pyramids. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.6033470418750042 eV/atom.

ZrN is Zincblende, Sphalerite structured and crystallizes in the cubic F-43m space group. Zr(1) is bonded to four equivalent N(1) atoms to form corner-sharing ZrN4 tetrahedra. All Zr(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.16 Å. N(1) is bonded to four equivalent Zr(1) atoms to form corner-sharing NZr4 tetrahedra. Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.6535506018750041 eV/atom.

ZrN is Molybdenum Carbide MAX Phase-like structured and crystallizes in the trigonal P-3m1 space group. Zr(1) is bonded to three equivalent N(1) and three equivalent N(2) atoms to form a mixture of distorted edge and corner-sharing ZrN6 pentagonal pyramids. All Zr(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.33 Å. All Zr(1)-N(2) bond lengths are 2.29 Å. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Zr(1) atoms to form a mixture of edge, face, and corner-sharing NZr6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 47°. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to six equivalent Zr(1) atoms to form a mixture of edge, face, and corner-sharing NZr6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 47°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -1.926353714375004 eV/atom.

There is one shorter (2.15 Å) and three longer (2.17 Å) Zr(1)-N(1) bond lengths. N(1) is bonded to four equivalent Zr(1) atoms to form corner-sharing NZr4 tetrahedra. The corner-sharing octahedra are not tilted. All Zr(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.29 Å. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Zr(1) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NZr6 octahedra. ZrN2 is Calaverite structured and crystallizes in the trigonal P-3m1 space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of one ZrN2 sheet oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. Zr(1) is bonded to six equivalent N(1) atoms to form distorted edge-sharing ZrN6 octahedra. All Zr(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.19 Å. N(1) is bonded in a trigonal non-coplanar geometry to three equivalent Zr(1) atoms. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.24985981638888602 eV/atom.

All Zr(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 2.28 Å. N(1) is bonded to four equivalent Zr(1) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NZr4 tetrahedra. ZrN2 crystallizes in the orthorhombic Pmmn space group. Zr(1) is bonded in a 8-coordinate geometry to four equivalent N(1) and four equivalent N(2) atoms. There are two shorter (2.17 Å) and two longer (2.42 Å) Zr(1)-N(1) bond lengths. There are two shorter (2.23 Å) and two longer (2.52 Å) Zr(1)-N(2) bond lengths. There are two inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded in a 5-coordinate geometry to four equivalent Zr(1) and one N(2) atom. The N(1)-N(2) bond length is 1.47 Å. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to four equivalent Zr(1) and one N(1) atom to form a mixture of distorted edge and corner-sharing NZr4N trigonal bipyramids.
